titlestmt.titleproper: Charles A. Poulson autograph collection undated ca. 1878-

scopecontent.p: Collection contains: miscellaneous correspondence with John McCallister (c.1855), James Glentworth (who served in the Revolutionary army, c. 1782) and others; copies of official documents (such as the Corporation of the City of Philadelphia, 1768); notes/reminiscences contained in 'Poulson's American Daily Advertiser' (c. 1828-1833) as well as loose sheets of papers; and various memorabilia such as an invitation to a Wistar party. One official document from Philadelphia City Hall dated 1852 indicates that Poulson was a member of the Common Council. The correspondence with Glentworth may have been the above-mentioned Poulson's father. [There was no folder for this collection.]
